intro: Agrestis, commonly known as the common agrimony, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caprifoliaceae. It is characterized by its upright, branched stems and opposite leaves that are typically oval to lance-shaped. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a reddish or purple tint. Agrestis is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks.
